Player History
Signed as a free agent by Oakland on 2/23/1969 to a 3-year deal worth $850,000 per year...
Drafted in 6th round, 111st overall pick, by Chicago (N) in 1972...
Traded from Chicago (N) to Los Angeles on 1/31/1977 (Going to LA: 2B M. DeJohn. Going to CHC: CF C. Lemon)...
Traded from Los Angeles to Cleveland on 3/2/1979 (Going to LA: C K. Moreland. Going to CLE: P H. Dues, 2B M. DeJohn, C J. Ransom)...
Had first career hit (double) on 4/4/1979, off Paul Hartzell (BOS)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/23/1979, off Ross Grimsley Jr. (TEX)...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/2/1979, hitting .500 with 0 HR, 5 RBI...
Injured on 5/3/1980 with a Sore Back, out for 1-2 weeks...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/15/1981, hitting .522 with 0 HR, 5 RBI...
Had 5 hits with 1 RBI against California on 6/19/1984...
Drove in 6 runs against New York (A) on 4/20/1986...
